title: 111_hr2776
content: The Act may be cited as the "Living Organ Donor Job Security Act" and provides leave for living organ donation. The "Living Organ Donor Job Security Act" amends the Family and Medical Leave Act to provide leave for living organ donation, including time for medical tests, evaluations, and transplantation services. The "Living Organ Donor Job Security Act" amends the Family and Medical Leave Act to provide leave for living organ donation, including time for medical tests, evaluations, and transplantation services, as well as recuperation consistent with the type of transplant performed. Federal employees are also included, with provisions for tests, evaluations, outpatient services, and postoperative care. The Family and Medical Leave Act is amended to include leave for living organ donation, covering tests, evaluations, transplantation services, travel, and recuperation. Non-federal employees are affected by the changes in sections 103(b)(4)(B) and 104(c)(3)(A)(ii). The Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 is further amended to include leave for living organ donation. Non-federal employees are affected by changes in various sections, including 102(b), 102(e)(2), and 103(c)(1). The Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 is amended to include leave for living organ donation in various sections, such as 102(b), 102(e)(2), 103(b)(5), and 104(a)(4). Title 5, United States Code, is further amended to include subparagraph (D) or (E) of section 102(a)(1) for federal employees.
